item.title: 1 Chronicles 1
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 1

1 Ch 1:1-16

5 The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, Tiras

6 The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Diphath, Togarmah;

8 The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, Canaan

9 The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, Sabteca.

10 Cush was father of Nimrod, a great man in the world.

11 The sons of Mizraim were the people of Lud, Anam, Lehab, Naphtuh, 12Pathrus, Casluh, where the Philistines came from, and Caphtor;

item.title: 1 Chronicles 2
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 2

1 The sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun, 2Dan, Joseph, Benjamin,

3 The sons of JUDAH: Er, Onan, and Shelah by Bath-shua the Canaanitess

4 Tamar Judah’s daughter-in-law bore him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all.

5 The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.

6 The sons of Zerah were Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—five.

8 The son of Ethan was Azariah. 1 Ch 2:1-8

item.title: 1 Chronicles 3
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 3

1 Ch 3:21-24

4 He ruled in Hebron for 7½ years and in Jerusalem for 33.

5 These were born in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon—four by Bath-shua daughter of Ammiel; 6and Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet, 7Nogah, Nepheg, and Japhia, 8Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet—nine. 9All those were sons of David besides the sons of concubines. Tamar was their sister. 1 Ch 3:1-9

10 Solomon’s son was Rehoboam father of Abijah father of Asa father of Jehoshaphat father of 11Joram father of Ahaziah father of Joash father of 12Amaziah father of Azariah father of Jotham father of 13Ahaz father of Hezekiah father of Manasseh father of 14Amon father of Josiah father of 15Johanan his firstborn, Jehoiakim second, Zedekiah third, and Shallum fourth.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 4
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 4

1 The sons of JUDAH: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal

2 Reaiah son of Shobal was father of Jahath father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the families of the Zorathites.

3 These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash; their sister was Hazzelelponi.

4 Penuel was father of Gedor and Ezer father of Hushah. Those were the sons of Hur, firstborn of Ephrathah ancestor of Bethlehem.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 5
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 5

1 The sons of REUBEN, Israel’s firstborn: 3Hanoch and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi (Because he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel; so he’s not enrolled in the genealogy by birthright. 2Although Judah prevailed over his brothers and the leader came from him, the birthright was Joseph’s.)

4 The sons of Joel were Shemaiah, Gog, Shimei, 5Micah, Reaiah, Baal, 6Beerah that Tilgath-pilneser, king of Assyria, took away into exile. He was leader in Reuben. 7His relatives by clans—when their genealogy was figured—were Jeiel the chief, then Zechariah, 8Bela son of Azaz son of Shema son of Joel that lived in Aroer as far as Nebo and Baal-meon. 9He lived to the east as far as the entrance to the desert this side of the River Euphrates because their livestock had multiplied in Gilead. 10At the time of Saul, they conquered the Hagrites and occupied their tents in the whole region east of Gilead. 1 Ch 5:1-10

item.title: 1 Chronicles 6
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 6

1 The descendants of LEVI: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari

2 The descendants of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

3 The children of Amram were Aaron, Moses, and Miriam.

4 Eleazar was father of Phinehas father of 5Abishua father of Bukki father of 6Uzzi father of Zerahiah father of 7Meraioth father of Amariah father of 8Ahitub father of Zadok father of 9Ahimaaz father of Azariah, father of 10Johanan father of Azariah (priest in the Temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem), and 11Azariah was father of Amariah father of 12Ahitub father of Zadok father of 13Shallum father of Hilkiah father of 14Azariah father of Seraiah father of 15Jehozadak, who went into exile when the LORD took Judah and Jerusalem away by Nebuchadnezzar. 1 Ch 6:1-15

item.title: 1 Chronicles 7
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 7

1 ISSACHAR had four sons: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron.

2 The sons of Tola were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Samuel, heads of

3 The son of Uzzi was Izrahiah.

4 With them by their generations according to their families were 36,000 troops of the army, because they had many wives and sons. 5Their relatives among the descendants of Issachar were trained soldiers, enrolled by genealogy—87,000 in all. 1 Ch 7:1-5

item.title: 1 Chronicles 8
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 8

1 BENJAMIN was father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel second, Aharah third, 2Nohah fourth, and Rapha fifth.

3 Bela was father of Addar, Gera, Abihud, 4Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah, 5Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.

6 These are the sons of Ehud, heads of families among the people in Geba. They were exiled to Manahath: 7Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera, father of Uzza and Ahihud.

8 Shaharaim was the father of children in Moab after he’d sent away his wives Hushim and Baara. 9By his wife Hodesh he became father of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam, 10Jeuz, Sachia, Mirmah, sons and heads of families. 11By Hushim he’d become father of Abitub and Elpaal. 1 Ch 8:1-11

item.title: 1 Chronicles 9
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 9

1 So Israel was enrolled by genealogies. They’re recorded in The Book of the Kings of Israel. Judah was exiled to Babylon because they were unfaithful.

2 The first to live again in their towns were Israel, the priests, the Levites, and the Temple servants. 3Some descendants of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh lived in Jerusalem: 4from the descendants of Perez son of Judah was Uthai son of Ammihud son of Omri son of Imri son of Bani; 7from the descendants of Benjamin were Sallu son of Meshullam son of Hodaviah son of Hassenuah, 8and Ibneiah son of Jeroham, Elah son of Uzzi son of Michri, and Meshullam son of Shephatiah son of Reuel son of Ibnijah, 9and their relatives by generations: 956. Those were heads of families. 1 Ch 9:1-9

item.title: 1 Chronicles 10
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 10

1 The Philistines attacked Israel, and they fled and fell dead on Mount Gilboa. 2The Philistines overtook Saul and his sons and struck down his sons Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchi-shua. 3The battle grew intense against Saul, and the archers wounded him. 4He told his armor bearer, “Draw your sword and thrust me through so these uncircumcised Philistines don’t come and torture me.” But his armor bearer was too afraid to do it; so Saul took his sword and fell on it. 5When his armor bearer saw he was dead, he fell on his sword too. 6So Saul’s whole dynasty died together.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 11
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 11

1 Then Israel gathered to David in Hebron, “We’re your flesh and bone. 2When Saul was king, you led out and brought in Israel. The LORD your God said you would shepherd his people and be their leader."

3 The elders in Israel came to him, and he made a treaty with them in the LORD’s presence. They anointed him king according to the LORD’s message through Samuel.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 12
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 12

1 These are men that came over to David at Ziklag, while he still couldn’t move around freely because of Saul. They were among the elite soldiers that helped him during war. 2They used bows. With either hand they could sling stones and shoot arrows. They were Saul’s relatives from Benjamin. 3The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet, sons of Azmaveth; Beracah and Jehu the Anathothite; 4Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, an elite soldier among the 30 and a leader over them. Then came Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, Jozabad the Gederathite, 5Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, Shephatiah the Haruphite; 6Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, Jashobeam, the Korahites; 7Joelah and Zebadiah, sons of Jerobam of Gedor.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 13
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 13

1 Then David consulted with every commander of thousands and hundreds, 2and told the whole assembly, “If it seems good to you and if the LORD our God wills, let’s send around to our relatives that are still in Israel, as well as to the priests and Levites that are with them in their towns and pastures, to have them meet with us. 3Let’s bring the Ark back. We neglected it in Saul’s time."

item.title: 1 Chronicles 14
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 14

1 Hiram, king of Tyre, sent ambassadors to David with cedar trees, masons, and carpenters, to build him a palace. 2David saw that the LORD had made him secure as king over Israel, and that his kingdom was highly regarded for Israel’s sake. 3He took more wives at Jerusalem and had more sons and daughters. 4His children born in Jerusalem were Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, 5Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet, 6Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia, 7Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet. 1 Ch 14:1-7

item.title: 1 Chronicles 15
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 15

1 Ch 15:1-15

11 David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests and for the Levites Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab, 12"You’re heads of families among the Levites. Consecrate yourselves and your relatives so you can bring the Ark up to the place I’ve prepared. 13You didn’t carry it the first time, so the LORD lashed out on us; we didn’t look to him according to the ordinance."

item.title: 1 Chronicles 16
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 16

1 Ch 16:1-7

4 He appointed some Levites to serve at the Ark—to celebrate, thank, and praise the LORD God of Israel: 5Asaph the chief, second to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel with musical instruments—harps and lyres. Asaph played the loud cymbals; 6Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests blew bugles constantly in front of the Ark.

7 That day David first assigned Asaph and his relatives to give thanks to the LORD.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 17
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 17

1 Ch 17:15-27

2 Nathan said, “Do what’s in your mind. God is with you."

3 That same night, the message from God came to him, 4"Go tell my servant David, ‘The LORD says, “You’re not to build me a temple. 5I haven’t lived in a temple since I brought Israel up. I’ve gone from tent to tent and place to place. 6In all the places where I’ve lived with Israel, have I asked any judge that I’ve commanded to shepherd my people why he hasn’t built me a cedar temple?”’ 7Tell David, ‘The LORD of Hosts says, “I took you out of the pasture from behind sheep and made you a leader over Israel. 8I’ve been with you wherever you’ve gone and removed your enemies from you. I’ll make you as famous as anyone that’s ever lived in the world. 9I’ll appoint you a place for my people, and plant them so they won’t have to move anymore. Sinful people won’t lay waste to them like they did before, 10including the time I put judges over them. I’ll subdue your enemies and build you a dynasty. 11When your life’s over and you’ve gone to your ancestors, I’ll set up one of your sons and secure his throne permanently. 12He’ll build me a temple. 13I’ll be his father, and he’ll be my son. I won’t take my enduring love away from him like I did with your predecessor. 14I’ll settle him in my house and kingdom permanently.”’” 1 Ch 17:1-14

item.title: 1 Chronicles 18
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 18

1 After that, David defeated the Philistines and took Gath and its surrounding towns. 2He defeated Moab and they brought tribute. 3He defeated Hadadezer, king of Zobah, as far as Hamath and secured his rule all the way to the Euphrates River. 4He took 1,000 chariots, 7,000 cavalry, and 20,000 foot soldiers. He hamstrung the chariot horses but reserved enough for 100 chariots.

5 When the Arameans from Damascus came to help Hadadezer, David killed 22,000 of them. 6He put garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans brought tribute. 7He took the gold shields that Hadadezer’s officers carried and brought them to Jerusalem. 8From Tibhath and Cun, towns of Hadadezer, he took a large amount of bronze, which Solomon used to make the bronze sea, pillars, and bronze utensils. 1 Ch 18:1-8

item.title: 1 Chronicles 19
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 19

1 After this, Nahash, king of the Ammonites, died and his son became king. 2David said, “I’ll be kind to Hanun because his father was kind to me.” He sent ambassadors to console him about his father. 3But the officials in Ammon told Hanun, “Do you think David is honoring your father by sending ambassadors to comfort you? Haven’t they come to spy out the land to overthrow it?” 4Hanun took David’s ambassadors and shaved them, cut off their cloaks as high as their hips, and sent them away. 5Some people came and told David about the men. He sent to meet them because they were humiliated. He told them to stay in Jericho till their beards grew back; then come home.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 20
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 20

1 In the spring, when kings go to war, Joab led out the army and ravaged the country of the Ammonites and laid siege to Rabbah. David stayed in Jerusalem. Joab attacked Rabbah and overthrew it. 2Then David went to Rabbah and took the crown off their king’s head, and found that it weighed 75½ lbs a talent of gold, and was set with precious stones. They placed it on David’s head, and he brought out a really large amount of spoil from the city. 3He brought the people out, and cut them with saws, sharp instruments, and axes. He did that to all the Ammonite towns. Then he and the people came back to Jerusalem.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 21
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 21

1 Ch 21:13-17

3 Joab said, “May the LORD add to his people 100 times as many as they are! But my lord the king, aren’t they all serving you? Why do you want to know this? Why bring guilt on Israel?"

4 But the king’s word prevailed. So Joab went all over Israel and came back to Jerusalem. 5He gave David the census number: 1,100,000 swordsmen in Israel and 470,000 in Judah. 6He didn’t count Levi and Benjamin because he abhorred the king’s command. 7God was displeased with this thing, so he struck Israel. 1 Ch 21:1-7

item.title: 1 Chronicles 22
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 22

1 Ch 22:6-16

2 David issued an order to gather the foreigners in Israel and set stonecutters to dress stones for God’s Temple. 3He provided large stores of iron for making nails for the doors in the gates and for clamps, more bronze than could be weighed, 4and cedar logs without number. The Sidonians and Tyrians brought him large supplies of cedar timber. 5He said, “My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and the LORD’s Temple will be magnificent, famous, and glorious all over the world. I’ll stockpile materials for it."

item.title: 1 Chronicles 23
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 23

1 Ch 23:24-32

7 The sons of Gershon were Ladan and Shimei.

8 Three sons of Ladan were Jehiel the oldest, Jetham, and Joel.

9 Three sons of Shimei were Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran. 10-11The other sons of Shimei were Jahath, first; Zina/Zizah, second. Jeush and Beriah didn’t have very many sons, so they were all counted as one family. 1 Ch 23:7-11

12 The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 24
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 24

1 These were the divisions of Aaron’s descendants. His sons were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar. 2But Nadab and Abihu died before their father did, and they didn’t have any sons; so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests. 3David—with Zadok from Eleazar’s descendants and Ahimelech from Ithamar’s descendants—divided them by their offices for their service. 4Since there were more chief men descended from Eleazar than from Ithamar, they divided them into 16 heads descended from Eleazar and 8 from Ithamar. 5They divided them alike by lot because they were officers of the sanctuary and officers of God. 6Shemaiah son of Nethanel the secretary from the Levites, recorded them in the presence of the king, the officials, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech son of Abiathar, and the heads of the families among the priests and Levites—one family taken for Eleazar and one for Ithamar. 1 Ch 24:1-6

item.title: 1 Chronicles 25
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 25

1 Ch 25:20-31

5 Those were sons of Heman, the king’s seer, to honor him according to God’s message, because God gave Heman 14 sons and 3 daughters.

6 Those were under their father’s direction to sing in the LORD’s Temple, with cymbals, harps, and lyres for the service. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman served under the king’s direction. 7There were 288 trained in singing to the LORD with their relatives, talented men. 8They cast lots for their duties, least and greatest, teacher and pupil. 1 Ch 25:1-8

item.title: 1 Chronicles 26
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 26

1 Ch 26:1-11

4 Obed-edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad second, Joah third, Sacar fourth, Nethanel fifth, 5Ammiel sixth, Issachar seventh, and Peullethai eighth. God had blessed him. 6Shemaiah had sons who governed their family because they were brave soldiers: 7Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose brothers Elihu and Semachiah were brave men. 8Obed-edom’s sons, their sons and relatives were capable and strong for the service—62.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 27
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 27

1 These were the heads of families, commanders of thousands and hundreds, and their officers that served the king in regard to the divisions that came in and went out month by month all year. Each division numbered 24,000.

2 Jashobeam son of Zabdiel was responsible for the first division for the first month. 3He descended from Perez and was chief of the commanders of the army for the first month.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 28
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 28

1 David gathered to Jerusalem the officials in Israel, the leaders of the tribes, the commanders of the divisions that served the king, the commanders over thousands and hundreds, the overseers of the property and livestock that belong to the king and his sons, the officials and elite soldiers, all the brave warriors. 2He stood up and said, “My relatives, my people, I intended to build a permanent temple for the Ark of the Covenant and for a footstool of our God; so I made preparations. 3But he told me, ‘You won’t build me a house; you’re a soldier that’s shed blood.’ 4But the LORD chose me from my father’s family to rule Israel permanently. He chose Judah to lead, chose my father’s family in Judah, and delighted in me among my brothers. 5From my sons he’s chosen Solomon to sit on the throne. (The LORD has given me many sons.) 6He told me, ‘Solomon will build my temple and courts. I’ve chosen him to be my son, and I’ll be his father. 7I’ll make his kingdom permanently secure if he’s resolute in keeping my commandments and ordinances, like he is today.’ 8In front of Israel, in the assembly of the LORD, and in the hearing of our God, endeavor to follow all his commandments so you can keep the good land and leave it for your descendants. 9"Solomon, son, know your father’s God. Serve him with all your heart and a willing mind, because the LORD examines every heart and understands every intent. 10Be diligent about that because he has chosen you to build a temple for the sanctuary. Have the courage to do it.” 1 Ch 28:1-10

item.title: 1 Chronicles 29
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 29

1 Ch 29:1-5

6 The heads of families made freewill offerings, as did the tribal leaders, the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and the officers over the king’s work. 7They gave for the service of God’s Temple 188¾ tons 5,000 talents of gold, 185 lbs 10,000 darics of gold, 377½ tons 10,000 talents of silver, 679½ tons 18,000 talents of brass, and 3775 tons 100,000 talents of iron. 8Whoever had precious stones gave them to the treasury in the care of Jehiel the Gershonite. 9The people celebrated because they had given willingly and offered freely with all their heart. David also celebrated greatly. 1 Ch 29:6-9
